title: Client App
description: A third-party application that uses the DLx API.

confidential.title: Confidential Client
confidential.description: Whether this application is capable of making secure requests. Determines what kinds of scopes the application may request.

id.title: Client ID
id.description: The unique ID for this application, a hyphen-separated lowercase UUID.

name.title: Application Name
name.description: The name of the application. Does not need to be unique.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: The permissions object for this application.

owner.title: Application Owners (Admin Access)
owner.description: An array of user IDs (emails) of owners (those who have admin access) for this application.

contributor.title: Application Contributors (Editors; Write Access)
contributor.description: An array of user IDs (emails) of contributors (editors; those who have write access) for this application.

viewer.title: Application Viewers (Read Access)
viewer.description: An array of user IDs of viewers (those who have read-only access) for this application.

public.title: Publicly Listed
public.description: Whether this application is publicly listed and viewable.

redirects.title: Redirect URLs
redirects.description: An array of redirect URLs that were provided during app registration.

items.title: Redirect URL
items.description: A URL that the DLx authentication server will redirect to during the authentication process. The authentication server will not redirect to URLs that are not listed here.

scopes.title: Permitted Scopes
scopes.description: A hash of scopes that this application has permission to use.

db.title: Database (Admin) Scope
db.description: Whether the application has database (administrative) scope.

offline.title: Offline Scope
offline.description: Whether the application can access a user's resources even when the user is not logged in.

profile.title: Profile Scope
profile.description: Whether the application can access information aabout the user's profile, such as their email.

public.title: Public Scope
public.description: Whether the application can access publicly available resources.

user.title: User Scope
user.description: Whether the application can access a user's resources on their behalf, if the user is logged in.

secret.title: Client Secret
secret.description: The app secret (key), a random 20-character hex string.
